gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਸਫਲ ਬਨ ਬਿਖੈ ਬਿਰਖ ਬਿਬਿਧਿ ਜਾ ਕੋ ਫਲੁ ਮੀਠੋ ਖਗ ਤਾਪੋ ਚਲਿ ਜਾਤਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Sadhal Ban Bikhai Birakh Bibidhi , Jaa Ko Dhalu Meettho Khag Taapo Chali Jaati Hai ?
translation: Just as a fruit orchard has many types of fruit trees, but birds fly only to the one which has sweet fruit.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਪਰਬਤ ਬਿਖੈ ਦੇਖੀਅੈ ਪਾਖਾਨ ਬਹੁ ਜਾ ਮੈ ਤੋ ਹੀਰਾ ਖੋਜੀ ਖੋਜ ਖਨਵਾਰਾ ਲਲਚਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Parabat Bikhai Daykheeai Paakhaan Bahu , Jaa Mai To Heeraa Khojee Khoj Khanavaaraa Lalachaat Hai ?
translation: Numerous types of stones are available in the mountains but one in search of diamond longs to see the stone that can yield one a diamond.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਜਲਧਿ ਮਧਿ ਬਸਤ ਅਨੰਤ ਜੰਤ ਮੁਕਤਾ ਅਮੋਲ ਜਾਮੈ ਹੰਸ ਖੋਜ ਖਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Jaladhi Madhi Basat Anant Janta , Moukataa Amol Jaamai Hans Khoj Khaat Hai ?
translation: Just as a lake is inhabited by many forms of marine life, but a swan visits only that lake which has pearls in its oyster.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਹੈ ਅਸੰਖ ਸਿਖ ਜਾ ਮੈ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਤਾਹਿ ਲੋਕ ਲਪਟਾਤ ਹੈ ||੩੬੬||
transliteration: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Hai Asankh Sikha , Jaa Mai Gur Giaan Taahi Lok Lapataat Hai ?366?
translation: Similarly-numerous Sikhs reside in the refuge of the True Guru. But he who has the knowledge of Guru residing in his heart, people feel attracted and enamoured to him. (366)
